file_content.text: Thanks for the help on Taris.
Decent of you to let me in on the kill. You didn't have to do that.
Jicoln was your target. Decent of you to let me in for the capture..
Wasn't exactly charity. Jicoln was my target. You got me close to him.
Worked for both of us, then.
Couldn't let him keep dragging your clan's honor through the dirt.
I got my target, you got your honor back. There's something for everyone.
Worked out for both of us.
Couldn't have found Jicoln without you.
Looking forward to this. Not everyone gets to fight beside the Champion of the Great Hunt.
Won't keep you waiting. Might as well find some action.
Stick with me, kid, and I can pretty much promise things won't get boring.
I can think of better things for us to do than fight.
Always glad to have another good hand.
Say the word, I'm ready to move out.
Your advice earlier about Mako... helped.
Don't screw this up. You'll make the whole ship miserable.
If you make her cry, I'm obligated to kill you. Just so you know.
You better be good to her.
Mako and I wouldn't work out.
Don't think we speak the same language.
Things are less complicated this way.
Let's go shoot something, take your mind off her.
She doesn't seem like your type.
I can't imagine you in a kitchen.
Hardly ever been in a kitchen. Mosty cook in the field.
What are you standing around for? Go.
Gotta have proof if you're making claims like that, Torian.
I won't interrupt. Just passing through.
I'm sort of afraid to ask...
She works for me, that's all.
That's creepy just to think about.
So you're not going to shoot me if I go after her, then?
We were. It didn't work out.
I like her. I thought maybe...
Better go talk to her, then.
It's a small ship. If things go bad, life could get ugly.
It's a safe bet she's not interested.
Don't waste time. Go after her.
You're right. I'll say something to her.
You think she's interested, or you figure this'll just be good for a laugh?
Just want to see me shot down?
It's Mako. She's not going to shoot you. Just go.
Our people have a saying, "Aliit ori'shya tal'din." You know it?
My people have a saying, "Family is more than blood."
I'm glad you came to Taris.
It's been good having you at my back.
It's lucky you decided to tag along with me.
Luck had nothing to do with it. I know a sure thing when I see it.
You're like family to me, too.
I'll watch your six, no matter what.
I love you, Torian, but I still don't know what you're saying when you speak in Mando'a.
Sorry. Get a little tongue-tied speaking Basic.
That sounds suspiciously like you're about to hit me up for a favor.
You're a deadly shot, and you're adorable when you're nervous. I can't possibly refuse.
I love you, but I'm not ready for that.
I'll be here when you are.
I've been... wanting to know something.
You should know by now to just spit it out.
Either you're about to ask for money, or you've got something heavy on your mind.
I hope you know you can always talk to me.
You know you can ask anything.
If we ever had children, would they be raised Mandalorian?
Second question: What would you say if I asked you to marry me?
While we're idly speculating here, I might also say I'd grab you and kiss you.
Mhi solus tome, mhi solus dar'tome, mhi me'dinui an, mhi ba'juri verde.
I'm not looking to settle down.
I'm not planning on settling down and being anyone's mother.
My children won't be brainwashed by Mandos.
We haven't really talked since my induction.
I'll look into it for you.
You're not thinking of picking up your father's cause?
Didn't I promise to teach you Mando'a? Seems to me I've been neglecting you.
I do remember you offering me lessons.
Ought to remedy that, I think.
You have been neglecting me pretty badly.
I'll make it up to you.
I'm sure there's something you could do to apologize.
You could make it up to me.
Are you busy? I thought maybe you could give me some shooting lessons.
I suppose I could do that.
Maybe we could skip the lesson and do something else instead?
Or we could just say I did.
You know, I think I could be persuaded to cancel my plans for a few hours.
You could talk me into it.
I'll try to be real persuasive, then.
Why don't we go somewhere private for a while?
You really are beautiful, you know that? I could get used to this.
You've got the makings of a strong leader.
Guess it won't be long before you take off on your own.
There's a "but" coming. I can tell.
I don't see a problem there.
I don't want to cause trouble for you. Mandalore and Clan Cadera aren't exactly close.
You just figure that out? I could've told you that.
I've known for a while. Just trying to figure out if I've gotten us both in trouble with Mandalore.
But maybe I'm only causing trouble for me.
Mandalore is your clan leader. I don't want to cause trouble for you.
What's he going to do? Ground me?
That just makes things more interesting.
It's not going to work, though.
You're not Mandalorian. You don't understand us. Or respect us. You insulted Mandalore to his face.
Seems like I'm just asking for trouble.
The future can sort itself out.
You think I'm going to break your heart?
You'll probably break more than my heart.
We've got something. Maybe it won't be easy, but it's still worth trying.
However long forever turns out to be, I'm yours.
You should arrange a gathering, get the clan together.
You oughtta know relatives are more trouble than they're worth. You're better off on your own.
Tangle with Jedi and someone's bound to get hurt.
Dancing with a lightsaber's a good way to lose weight.
You can bet we'll be seeing more than our fair share of Jedi.
I've got a mission, thought you might want in on it.
Clan Ordo's been hired to kill a Senator who's hiding out under major Jedi protection.
It'll be a serious engagement. He's gone to ground in a heavily fortified area. Worth a lot of credits, too.
If you're interested, meet us at the Baliss estate on Alderaan. Corridan out.
Jedi hunt. They're in for a fight.
Think they're in over their heads?
Let me guess: you want to go.
Better get going, don't want to miss the fight.
You think he meant it? Or was that just talk?
He might have inside info we don't. Maybe he knows where things'll heat up.
True. He's always been good at getting intel he shouldn't have.
It's just eating you up that he might go to war while you don't.
He's your friend. You'd know better than I would.
Corridan means what he says, mostly.
Unless he's trying to impress a pretty girl, of course.
Almost hope he's wrong. This armor might not be up to a decent fight.
It's okay. Might hold up. Might not.
That some kind of hint that you want to buy new armor?
Are you asking to go shopping?
What, exactly's the matter with it?
Maybe nothing. Might hold up. Hard to say.
Mandalore gave you a piece of beskar'gam, didn't he?
Should be made from beskar. Only our people can work it.
Never heard of it. Why's it important?
It's stronger than durasteel. Can take lightsaber hits if it has to. Can't find better.
I would've taken better care of it, if I knew that.
Wouldn't worry too much about it. The warrior's more important than the armor.
Better to shoot first and not get hit.
Always better to have a backup plan.
For Mandalorians, it's a second skin. If we don't make our own, we customize it.
Seems like you might want to get to work on it, then.
I probably should. Never hurts to be prepared.
I thought you guys wore that stuff to compensate for something.
So it's not just for show?
If it's that important, we'll have to get you properly geared.
We'll see what we can do.
This can wait. We ought to get to work.
Been working on a new shot.
Something I picked up watching you. Want to check it out?
Think it'd be best to try it in a real firefight.
I'm having trouble thinking of anything better than watching you shoot.
Good. Showing off for you was pretty much the point.
I'm game. You want to try it out on targets, or something that'll shoot back?
Always better when it shoots back, don't you think?
I suppose we ought to see you get some practice in.
Let's get to work. Sooner we're moving, the sooner you can see me in action.
Good to see my brothers are still alive. Corridan owes me fifty credits.
He owes me a lot more; I was lonely with you gone.
[Flirt] I hated to see you go.
Try not to spring any more vacations on me.
Mandalore tell you the Resol'nare when you were adopted into his clan?
Is that something I should know?
There was a lot of stuff in Mandalorian. Could have been talking about the weather for all I know.
Resol'nare means, "Six actions." The core of Mandalorian life.
Speaking the language is a big one. I could teach you, if you're up for it.
I've got work to do. Language lessons'll have to wait.
Learning a new language sounds a lot like work I don't get paid for.
Guess we'd better move on, then.
Private lessons from you? I can think of worse ways to spend my time.
Could learn all kinds of things.
I probably ought to know what my people are saying about me.
I might take you up on that.
Have to find some time later, then.
I agreed to be made Mandalorian just to shut him up.
I don't care about that stuff.
Mandalore offered you a place in his clan, didn't he? Why'd you say no?
Got to be free to pick up jobs. Can't have Mandalore telling me what to do.
Didn't want to be tied down.
He doesn't do that. Just calls the clans to war.
Just seemed like a good idea at the time.
He was right. You'd have made a good Mandalorian.
No point in dwelling on it.
Wouldn't a "good Mandalorian" be sort of like a skinny Hutt or a fun Jedi?
I've already got one good Mandalorian around here. How many do we need?
You can never have too many.
Want to tell me what makes for a good Mando?
Skill. Honor. Discipline. You probably wouldn't have had any trouble with it.
Guess you get by well enough on your own, though.
Ought to get moving, I think.
That's between me and Mandalore, isn't it?
After you won the Great Hunt, maybe?
How would I tell if it were Mando cooking?
If your sinuses got burned, it was probably Mandalorian.
Hetikles. "Noseburn." It's how you know it's good.
Is that your way of asking me out?
Thought I might make you some tiingilar. See what you think.
Pick a time, and we'll have dinner.
If I say yes, am I going to regret it?
Think of it as a challenge. They say any woman who can survive a plate of tiingilar is a keeper.
I'll fix you some, soon as I can get back to the galley.
I'm not eating your toxic Mando food.
I've been meaning to track some down.
It's something I'd like to try.
I won't turn down a hot meal.
If I say yes, am I going to regret it?
It probably won't hurt you much. Think of it as a challenge.
Think I'll wait for the real thing, thanks.
Did my big hunter skin us a fireside rug?
Don't know half the words you just said, but I get the idea.
Turns out Corridan heard about us taking down Jicoln on Taris.
We don't have time for social calls, Torian.
He didn't draw a line in the sand, I hope.
See you when I see you, Torian.
Not going to introduce me to this friend of yours?
Thought you wanted to join my hunts and learn something, but have fun playing around with your friend.
It's gotten a lot better since you got here.
Good to have you with us.
I carry this crew. They just take up space on the ship.
Haven't been part of a company since Eriadu. Missed it, I guess.
Can't think why you'd miss that.
I'm shocked. Seemed like a real tight group on Dromund Kaas.
Jogo wasn't a good squad mate?
Jogo was never in danger of becoming popular.
Commander Fett's men didn't seem too bad.
What about the guys on Taris?
You can stick with us from now on.
Well, you got this one now.
Got to have someone watching your six.
Wonder what Clan Ordo's doing now?
Mind if I ask you a personal question?
You want to ask me something, ask.
If I answer it, I get to ask you something personal.
[Flirt] If I can ask you one.
Gonna make me talk about my feelings?
You can ask whatever you want. I'm not saying I'll answer.
Relationships get in the way of business.
No, but I could be talked into it by the right guy.
Really? I'll have to remember that.
Is that idle curiosity, or was there another question you wanted to ask?
What made you want to run off to hunt bounties instead of staying on Taris to fight?
You're much prettier than Commander Fett.
You work for me. Nothing more. Got it?
If that's all it took, I'm surprised you didn't leave Taris with a wookiee.
Did you just call me pretty?
What do you look for in a woman?
She has to be Mandalorian. And she's got to be a better shot than me.
I'm two for two. What do I win?
Not much of a prize right now. I better work on that.
Aside from being Mando, you just described everyone on Hutta.
Ouch. Guess I'll have to check out Hutta, then.
The usual. Good aim. Tracking skills. At least durasteel armor...
I think I fit that description...
So you don't care if she's covered in fur and smells like a swamp?
I don't know. Can she cook?
Got to be one of those around somewhere...
I'll see if we can find one.
Your turn to tell me: You seeing anyone?
Not yet. Thinking about it, though.
We should get moving. We can talk later.
Didn't want to be small-time forever.
When Braden was murdered, there wasn't room for second thoughts.
It's not something I can just sum up for you.
Great alor'ad. Served with him and his clan on Eriadu. Told you about that, right?
You said you'd been in some fights. Didn't say where.
Sent in to secure a weapons factory. Half the planet is factories. Like Coruscant, but dirtier.
Pretty quiet, except for snipers and mines. Real trouble was waiting in the factory.
Resistance fighters. Geared with stealth generators. Hiding among the workers.
Stealth fields don't fool thermal detonators.
That's a situation that could get messy real fast.
Don't present a target, shoot from cover. Smart guys.
Corridan got most of the workers out. Got us under cover. Could have been worse.
Good at thinking on his feet. Sort of like you.
That's it for story time. Let's get moving.
You don't make it far in this business if you miss.
I've seen successful hunters who couldn't shoot to save their lives.
You've been staring at me for this long and all you notice is my aim? I'm disappointed.
Less likely to shoot me if I only mentioned your aim.
We could get the ship to ourselves. I'll show you all kinds of things I'm good with.
We should find some downtime first.
It's nice to see a professional in action. Quite the view.
I don't need your mind or your eyes wandering.
The view from here's not bad, either.
I'd be happy to give you a better view anytime.
Got to be a good shot in this business.
I've seen hunters who couldn't hit the broad side of a dreadnaught.
I've killed how many things now, and you just picked up on that?
Mandalorians can't throw that kind of compliment around lightly.
Nice to see a professional in action. Might even learn a few things hanging around you.
Nobody touches my gun, you got that?
What sort of jobs are coming up? Hunting? Mercenary work?
You never know, in this business.
Should keep me on my toes.
There something in particular you're hoping to see?
Something hard enough to sharpen myself on.
Don't sweat it. Shouldn't be anything we can't handle.
Been in a few skirmishes. Treaty with the Republic made real fighting scarce.
Only kind of job I take.
We're not looking for glory, Torian, we're doing a job.
We fight what we're paid for.
You really want to see something worthy, I could oblige.
Knew coming with you was a good idea.
Looking for at least ten to one odds, or will you be satisfied with just one of something nasty?
I'm a bounty hunter, not a general. You won't see any big battles.
Our people need battle to find out what we are.
Mandalorians need battle. It's the only way we test ourselves.
Mando without war is like a starship without space.
We'll see combat. War, I can't guarantee you.
Guess we better find you a war, then.
I'm not getting mixed up in some war just so you can feel good about yourself.
Want to talk when we get back to the ship.
When we've got a minute, I want to talk.
Know he's letting you do your thing... you're still blood, though.
Know you two aren't close, but you walk the same trail.
Just want to talk, man to man.
Made contact with some of my cousins.
Got a lot to learn before I try leading a clan.
Fighting alongside Mandalore's chosen can't hurt.
Winning a few more glories with a Grand Champion couldn't hurt.
Not much of clan Cadera left, aren't close either. Got spread out after the schism.
Crusader's schism. What they called the war between the clans.
Never had reason to celebrate our heritage before.
If that were true, wouldn't be many Mandos left.
Ordo, Kelborn, Itera. They all recovered. Think it was the shame that kept us apart.
Feud's settled now. Maybe it's time. Cin vhetin.
Took a lightsaber strike, glanced off his big head.
Gave an account worth remembering. Can't ask much more.
Deserve their reputation, that's for sure.
Didn't care to find out firsthand--never let them get close.
Kept the fire on the Senator. Didn't leave 'em any choice.
Can't count on a good distraction every time I cross a Jedi.
Better find some beskar if I'm making a habit of it.
Remember how Corridan thought things would be heating up? Listen.
They're my brothers. I need to be there.
You're sights are set on bigger game. I got this one.
You don't leave being Mando behind.
Been thinking about something Corridan said. Thought he'd be seeing some real action again soon.
Never thanked you, not making a big deal over me taking off.
Think I can spot him that one.
Been craving it since I left. Food here's a little bland. No offense.
Thought I'd put something together next chance I got. Interested?
Let you know. Next time I'm headed to the galley.
Amazing. Met Corridan and half my unit on Dxun. Good hunting. Bomas and Maalraas mostly.
Jagger bagged a zakkeg. Lucky jare.
Behemoth, like a tank with a temper. Caught it under the chin with a concussion missile, took two.
Tried. Maalraas aren't known for their hide, just their mange.
Got a few more stories to tell. Can't ask for much else.
Back to hunting prey on two legs. Right?
That friend I said you reminded me of? Got a holocall from him.
Don't plan on troubling you, can make my own way.
Over Jicoln? No. He'd have done the same as us.
Said he's hunting big game. Offered to let me in on it. Plan to take him up on that.
Wanted to let you know. Won't be long.
Don't like competition. Corridan'd spend the trip trying to impress with you along.
I want you to meet him, got catching up to do first.
With you, be a short trip.
Guess it's only fair I let you ask one, too. Shoot.
What made you enter the Great Hunt?
Mandos can't get comfortable in one place.
Your mentor. Mako told me about Blood and you.
Think it'd be the same for me. My father deserves a better legacy.
Think it wouldn't be about me either. My name, my clan, we'd share glories with our shames.
Asked myself the same question, got that answer too.
Next hunt gets called, I plan to be there.
Be in the thick of it soon.
